item.title: Deciphering the Role of CARD15/NOD2 in Inflammatory Diseases: Insights into Crohn's Disease and Blau Syndrome
item.description: CARD15 /NOD2 is the most prominent gene linked to Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD). Its connection to Crohn’s Disease (CD) was simultaneously identified by two research groups and has since been further validated by numerous studies (Hugot et al., 2001; Ogura et al., 2001a). Located on chromosome 16q12 , corresponding to the IBD1 locus, the CARD15/NOD2 gene exhibits around 60 polymorphisms, including 30 mutations leading to significant amino acid changes in the protein (Lesage et al.
